segments.en: Numbered Discourses 4
6. Overflowing Merit
57. Suppavāsā

segments.pli: Ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā koliyesu viharati pajjanikaṃ nāma koliyānaṃ nigamo.
segments.en: At one time the Buddha was staying in the land of the Koliyans, where they have a town named Pajjanika.

segments.pli: Atha kho bhagavā pubbaṇhasamayaṃ nivāsetvā pattacīvaramādāya yena suppavāsāya koliyadhītuyā nivesanaṃ tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā paññatte āsane nisīdi.
segments.en: Then the Buddha robed up in the morning and, taking his bowl and robe, went to the home of Suppavāsā the Koliyan, where he sat on the seat spread out.

segments.pli: Atha kho suppavāsā koliyadhītā bhagavantaṃ paṇītena khādanīyena bhojanīyena sahatthā santappesi sampavāresi.
segments.en: Then Suppavāsā served and satisfied the Buddha with her own hands with a variety of delicious foods.

segments.pli: Atha kho suppavāsā koliyadhītā bhagavantaṃ bhuttāviṃ onītapattapāṇiṃ ekamantaṃ nisīdi.
segments.en: When the Buddha had eaten and washed his hand and bowl, she sat down to one side.

segments.pli: Ekamantaṃ nisinnaṃ kho suppavāsaṃ koliyadhītaraṃ bhagavā etadavoca:
segments.en: The Buddha said to her:

segments.pli: “Bhojanaṃ, suppavāse, dentī ariyasāvikā paṭiggāhakānaṃ cattāri ṭhānāni deti.
segments.en: “Suppavāsā, when a noble disciple gives food, she gives the recipients four things.
What four?

segments.pli: Āyuṃ deti, vaṇṇaṃ deti, sukhaṃ deti, balaṃ deti.
segments.en: Long life, beauty, happiness, and strength.

segments.pli: Āyuṃ kho pana datvā āyussa bhāginī hoti dibbassa vā mānusassa vā.
segments.en: Giving long life, she has long life as a god or human.

segments.pli: Vaṇṇaṃ datvā vaṇṇassa bhāginī hoti dibbassa vā mānusassa vā.
segments.en: Giving beauty, she has beauty as a god or human.

segments.pli: Sukhaṃ datvā sukhassa bhāginī hoti dibbassa vā mānusassa vā.
segments.en: Giving happiness, she has happiness as a god or human.

segments.pli: Balaṃ datvā balassa bhāginī hoti dibbassa vā mānusassa vā.
segments.en: Giving strength, she has strength as a god or human.

segments.pli: Bhojanaṃ, suppavāse, dentī ariyasāvikā paṭiggāhakānaṃ imāni cattāri ṭhānāni detīti.
segments.en: When a noble disciple gives food, she gives the recipients these four things.
When she gives well-prepared food,
pure, fine, and full of flavor,
that offering—given to people of integrity,
who have good conduct, and are big-hearted—
joins merit to merit. It’s very fruitful,
and is praised by those who know the world.
Those who recall such sacrifices,
live in the world full of joy.
They’ve driven out the stain of stinginess down to the root,
blameless, they go to a heavenly place.”
